title: Plurals: one or many
description: Слушайте и различайте единственное и множественное число.

tasks.audioText: A woman is at a fruit shop. She looks at the shelf. I need three apples, please.

options.text: She wants one apple.
She wants three apples.
She wants three oranges.
She wants two apples.

tasks.explanation: 'Three apples' is a plural noun with a specific number. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A boy looks out the window. It is raining. There is one bird on the tree.
tasks.transcript: There is one bird on the tree.

options.text: There are many birds on the tree.
There are two birds on the tree.
There is a single bird on the tree.
There are no birds on the tree.

tasks.explanation: 'One bird' is singular — just one. Option 3 says the same with 'a single bird.'

tasks.audioText: A teacher counts the students in the classroom. She writes a number. There are twenty children here today.
tasks.transcript: There are twenty children here today.

options.text: There is one child in the classroom.
There are twelve children in the classroom.
There are twenty children in the classroom.
There are thirty children in the classroom.

tasks.explanation: 'Twenty children' uses the irregular plural of 'child.' Option 3 matches the number.

tasks.audioText: A man sets the table for dinner. He puts plates down. We need five forks.

options.text: He needs one fork.
He needs five spoons.
He needs five knives.
He needs five forks.

tasks.explanation: 'Five forks' is plural. Option 4 matches both the number and the item.

tasks.audioText: A girl goes to the shoe store. She tries on many pairs. These shoes are too big.

options.text: The shoes are too small.
The shoe is the right size.
The shoes are too big.
The shoes are very cheap.

tasks.explanation: 'Shoes' is plural, and they are 'too big.' Option 3 matches exactly.

tasks.audioText: A family visits a farm. The children are excited. There are six sheep in the field.
tasks.transcript: There are six sheep in the field.

options.text: There is one sheep in the field.
There are six cows in the field.
There are six sheep in the field.
There are six horses in the field.

tasks.explanation: 'Sheep' is the same in singular and plural. Six sheep means many. Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A man is at the dentist. He opens his mouth wide. Two teeth need fixing.

options.text: One tooth needs fixing.
Two teeth need fixing.
All teeth need fixing.
No teeth need fixing.

tasks.explanation: 'Two teeth' is the irregular plural of 'tooth.' Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A boy opens his birthday gifts. He is very happy. I got four new books!

options.text: He got one new book.
He got four new toys.
He got four new books.
He got four old books.

tasks.explanation: 'Four new books' — plural, with 'new' as the adjective. Option 3 matches.

tasks.audioText: A woman walks in the park. She sits on a bench. Many people are walking today.

options.text: One person is walking.
Nobody is walking today.
A few people are running today.
A lot of people are walking today.

tasks.explanation: 'Many people' is an irregular plural. 'A lot of' means the same as 'many.' Option 4 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A chef works in the kitchen. He cuts vegetables. I need two tomatoes for the salad.
tasks.transcript: I need two tomatoes for the salad.

options.text: He needs two potatoes for the salad.
He needs one tomato for the salad.
He needs two tomatoes for the soup.
He needs two tomatoes for the salad.

tasks.explanation: 'Two tomatoes' uses the -es plural. Option 4 matches the item, number, and dish.

tasks.audioText: A girl plays in the garden. She finds something. There are three butterflies on the flower.
tasks.transcript: There are three butterflies on the flower.

options.text: There is one butterfly on the flower.
There are three bees on the flower.
There are three butterflies on the flower.
There are three butterflies on the tree.

tasks.explanation: 'Three butterflies' uses the -ies plural ending. Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A mother packs lunch for school. She puts fruit in the box. There is one banana inside.

options.text: There is one banana in the box.
There are two bananas in the box.
There is one apple in the box.
There are many bananas in the box.

tasks.explanation: 'One banana' is singular. Option 1 correctly identifies one banana.

tasks.audioText: A man goes to the pet shop. He looks at the fish tanks. There are ten fish in this tank.
tasks.transcript: There are ten fish in this tank.

options.text: There is one fish in the tank.
There are ten birds in the tank.
There are ten fish in the tank.
There are twenty fish in the tank.

tasks.explanation: 'Fish' stays the same in plural. Ten fish means many. Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A boy is at the beach. He builds a sandcastle. I found two beautiful shells.

options.text: He found one beautiful shell.
He found two beautiful stones.
He found two ugly shells.
He found two beautiful shells.

tasks.explanation: 'Two beautiful shells' — plural with -s ending. Option 4 matches perfectly.

tasks.audioText: A woman works at a bakery. She counts the bread. We have eight loaves of bread left.
tasks.transcript: We have eight loaves of bread left.

options.text: They have one loaf of bread left.
They have eight loaves of bread left.
They have eight cakes left.
They have no bread left.

tasks.explanation: 'Eight loaves' uses the irregular plural of 'loaf.' Option 2 is correct.

short_description: Тренируйте различение единственного и множественного числа на слух.
